enWisdom: Generosity stems from nobility of character
Generosity is the symbol of magnanimity and nobility

Wisdom: الْكَرِيمُ إِذَا أَيْسَرَ أَسْعَفَ وَإِذَا أَعْسَرَ خَفَّفَ
enWisdom: When the munificent person is well-to-do, he fulfils the needs [of others] and when he faces hard times, he lightens the burden of others [by not seeking their assistance]
Munificence is [in] giving generously and fulfilling promises

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا سَرَاةُ النَّاسِ أُولُو الْأَحْلَامِ الرَّغِيبَةِ وَالْهِمَمِ الشَّرِيفَةِ وَذَوُو النُّبْلِ
enWisdom: Indeed the elite among the people are only those who have admirable intellects, honourable ambitions and are possessors of nobility
Through [his] abundant favours, the munificent person is recognized
Continuous bestowal [of favours] is the practice of the honourable
Generosity is the practice of the honourable
Generosity is the habit of the noble-minded people
Increased generosity is a sign of nobility

Wisdom: لَذَّةُ الْكِرَامِ فِي الْإِطْعَامِ وَلَذَّةُ اللِّئَامِ فِي الطَّعَامِ
enWisdom: The pleasure of the noble-minded people is in feeding [others] whereas the pleasure of the wicked people is in eating [themselves]

Wisdom: مَنْ كَرُمَتْ نَفْسُهُ اسْتَهَانَ بِالْبَذْلِ وَالْإِسْعَافِ
enWisdom: One whose soul is noble finds it easy to give generously and help others
Giving generously is from the traits of the munificent

Wisdom: مَسَرَّةُ الْكِرَامِ فِي بَذْلِ الْعَطَاءِ وَمَسَرَّةُ اللِّئَامِ فِي سُوءِ الْجَزَاءِ
enWisdom: The happiness of noble-minded people is in giving generously [to others] while the joy of the wicked is in evil retribution

Wisdom: يُسْتَدَلُّ عَلَى كَرَمِ الرَّجُلِ بِحُسْنِ بِشْرِهِ وَبَذْلِ بِرِّهِ
enWisdom: The nobleness of a man is evinced by his cheerfulness and his kindness [to others]
